intro: Melandrium flos-cuculi, commonly known as the Christmas pepper or ghost pepper, is a member of the Capparaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual plant that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its fruits are bright red, elongated pods that contain several seeds. It is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, and it thrives in disturbed soils and sunny habitats.
